answers.answer: Hello,Insulin doesn't cross the placenta, so it cannot have any direct effect on your baby.  What affects it is your blood sugar levels, and levels on the lower side of normal are best for baby.Are you anxious about taking your insulin?  I am only asking because if you are, maybe your stress is translating itself to your baby.Hope this helps.

question: Hey good morning/afternoon mommies!! I'm 32 weeks pregnant and I have GD so my question is when you take your insulin does your little peanut twitch like really bad like he's having a seizure because This didn't start happening until I started taking my insulin? Anyone experience this?
title: gestational diabetes
